channel.title: HTTP interfaces for graphs on ArangoDB Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in HTTP interfaces for graphs on ArangoDB Documentation

item.title: HTTP interface for named graphs
item.description: The HTTP API for named graphs is called Gharial. You can manage all types of ArangoDB’s named graphs with Gharial: General Graphs SmartGraphs EnterpriseGraphs SatelliteGraphs The examples use the following example graphs: Social Graph: Knows Graph: Management List all graphs GET /_api/gharial Lists all graphs stored in this database. Responses 200 OK Is returned if the module is available and the graphs can be listed. Response Body application/json object code* integer The HTTP response status code.

item.title: HTTP interface for edges
item.description: You can use the general Document API to create, read, modify, and delete edge documents. The only difference to working with vertex documents is that the _from and _to attributes are mandatory and must contain document identifiers. The Edge API is useful if you want to look up the inbound and outbound edges of a vertex with low overhead. You can also retrieve edges with AQL queries, but queries need to be parsed and planned, and thus have an overhead.
